poem:
Title: The Labor's Lament

The Brotherhood of St. Laurence,
like lovers in old romance,
dances no longer in labor's court,
its sentiments cut short.
In benevolence, they did engage,
but now they leave the stage,
where pawns of work for dole
are pushed into a hole,
the canvas of their meager day,
rendered in shades of gray.
